text: I. AN AMBUSCADE
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Early in the year VIII., at the beginning of Vendemiaire, or, to conform
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to our own calendar, towards the close of September, 1799, a hundred or
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: so of peasants and a large number of citizens, who had left Fougeres in
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the morning on their way to Mayenne, were going up the little mountain
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of La Pelerine, half-way between Fougeres and Ernee, a small town where
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: travellers along that road are in the habit of resting. This company,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: divided into groups that were more or less numerous, presented a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: collection of such fantastic costumes and a mixture of individuals
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: belonging to so many and diverse localities and professions that it will
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: be well to describe their characteristic differences, in order to give
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to this history the vivid local coloring to which so much value is
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: attached in these days,--though some critics do assert that it injures
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the representation of sentiments.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Many of the peasants, in fact the greater number, were barefooted, and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: wore no other garments than a large goatskin, which covered them from
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the neck to the knees, and trousers of white and very coarse linen, the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: ill-woven texture of which betrayed the slovenly industrial habits of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the region. The straight locks of their long hair mingling with those
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of the goatskin hid their faces, which were bent on the ground, so
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: completely that the garment might have been thought their own skin,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and they themselves mistaken at first sight for a species of the animal
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: which served them as clothing. But through this tangle of hair their
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: eyes were presently seen to shine like dew-drops in a thicket, and their
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: glances, full of human intelligence, caused fear rather than pleasure to
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: those who met them. Their heads were covered with a dirty head-gear of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: red flannel, not unlike the Phrygian cap which the Republic had lately
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: adopted as an emblem of liberty. Each man carried over his shoulder a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: heavy stick of knotted oak, at the end of which hung a linen bag with
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: little in it. Some wore, over the red cap, a coarse felt hat, with a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: broad brim adorned by a sort of woollen chenille of many colors which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: was fastened round it. Others were clothed entirely in the coarse linen
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of which the trousers and wallets of all were made, and showed nothing
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: that was distinctive of the new order of civilization. Their long
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: hair fell upon the collar of a round jacket with square pockets, which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: reached to the hips only, a garment peculiar to the peasantry of western
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: France. Beneath this jacket, which was worn open, a waistcoat of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: same linen with large buttons was visible. Some of the company marched
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: in wooden shoes; others, by way of economy, carried them in their hand.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: This costume, soiled by long usage, blackened with sweat and dust, and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: less original than that of the other men, had the historic merit of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: serving as a transition between the goatskins and the brilliant, almost
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: sumptuous, dress of a few individuals dispersed here and there among the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: groups, where they shone like flowers. In fact, the blue linen trousers
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of these last, and their red or yellow waistcoats, adorned with two
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: parallel rows of brass buttons and not unlike breast-plates, stood out
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: as vividly among the white linen and shaggy skins of their companions as
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the corn-flowers and poppies in a wheat-field. Some of them wore wooden
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: shoes, which the peasants of Brittany make for themselves; but the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: greater number had heavy hobnailed boots, and coats of coarse cloth cut
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: in the fashion of the old regime, the shape of which the peasants have
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: religiously retained even to the present day. The collars of their
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: shirts were held together by buttons in the shape of hearts or anchors.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The wallets of these men seemed to be better than those of their
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: companions, and several of them added to their marching outfit a flask,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: probably full of brandy, slung round their necks by a bit of twine. A
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: few burgesses were to be seen in the midst of these semi-savages, as if
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to show the extremes of civilization in this region. Wearing round hats,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: or flapping brims or caps, high-topped boots, or shoes and gaiters, they
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: exhibited as many and as remarkable differences in their costume as the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: peasants themselves. About a dozen of them wore the republican jacket
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: known by the name of "la carmagnole." Others, well-to-do mechanics, no
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: doubt, were clothed from head to foot in one color. Those who had most
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: pretension to their dress wore swallow-tail coats or surtouts of blue
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: or green cloth, more or less defaced. These last, evidently characters,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: marched in boots of various kinds, swinging heavy canes with the air and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: manner of those who take heart under misfortune. A few heads carefully
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: powdered, and some queues tolerably well braided showed the sort of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: care which a beginning of education or prosperity inspires. A casual
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: spectator observing these men, all surprised to find themselves in one
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: another's company, would have thought them the inhabitants of a village
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: driven out by a conflagration. But the period and the region in which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: they were gave an altogether different interest to this body of men.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Any one initiated into the secrets of the civil discords which were then
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: agitating the whole of France could easily have distinguished the few
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: individuals on whose fidelity the Republic might count among these
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: groups, almost entirely made up of men who four years earlier were at
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: war with her.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: One other and rather noticeable sign left no doubt upon the opinions
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: which divided the detachment. The Republicans alone marched with an air
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of gaiety. As to the other individuals of the troop, if their clothes
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: showed marked differences, their faces at least and their attitudes wore
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: a uniform expression of ill-fortune. Citizens and peasantry, their faces
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: all bore the imprint of deepest melancholy; their silence had something
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: sullen in it; they all seemed crushed under the yoke of a single
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: thought, terrible no doubt but carefully concealed, for their faces were
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: impenetrable, the slowness of their gait alone betraying their inward
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: communings. From time to time a few of them, noticeable for the rosaries
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: hanging from their necks (dangerous as it was to carry that sign of a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: religion which was suppressed, rather than abolished) shook their long
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: hair and raised their heads defiantly. They covertly examined the woods,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and paths, and masses of rock which flanked the road, after the manner
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of a dog with his nose to the wind trying to scent his game; and then,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: hearing nothing but the monotonous tramp of the silent company, they
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: lowered their heads once more with the old expression of despair, like
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: criminals on their way to the galleys to live or die.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The march of this column upon Mayenne, the heterogeneous elements
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of which it was composed, and the divers sentiments which evidently
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: pervaded it, will explain the presence of another troop which formed the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: head of the detachment. About a hundred and fifty soldiers, with arms
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and baggage, marched in the advance, commanded by the _chief of a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: half-brigade_. We may mention here, for the benefit of those who did
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: not witness the drama of the Revolution, that this title was made to
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: supersede that of colonel, proscribed by patriots as too aristocratic.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: These soldiers belonged to a demi-brigade of infantry quartered at
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Mayenne. During these troublous times the inhabitants of the west of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: France called all the soldiers of the Republic "Blues." This nickname
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: came originally from their blue and red uniforms, the memory of which is
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: still so fresh as to render a description superfluous. A detachment of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the Blues was therefore on this occasion escorting a body of recruits,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: or rather conscripts, all displeased at being taken to Mayenne where
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: military discipline was about to force upon them the uniformity of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: thought, clothing, and gait which they now lacked entirely.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: This column was a contingent slowly and with difficulty raised in the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: district of Fougeres, from which it was due under the levy ordered by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the executive Directory of the Republic on the preceding 10th Messidor.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The government had asked for a hundred million of francs and a hundred
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: thousand men as immediate reinforcements for the armies then fighting
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the Austrians in Italy, the Prussians in Germany, and menaced in
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Switzerland by the Russians, in whom Suwarow had inspired hopes of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: conquest of France. The departments of the West, known under the name
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of La Vendee, Brittany, and a portion of Lower Normandy, which had
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: been tranquil for the last three years (thanks to the action of General
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Hoche), after a struggle lasting nearly four, seemed to have seized this
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: new occasion of danger to the nation to break out again. In presence of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: such aggressions the Republic recovered its pristine energy. It provided
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: in the first place for the defence of the threatened departments by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: giving the responsibility to the loyal and patriotic portion of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: inhabitants. In fact, the government in Paris, having neither troops nor
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: money to send to the interior, evaded the difficulty by a parliamentary
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: gasconade. Not being able to send material aid to the faithful citizens
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of the insurgent departments, it gave them its "confidence." Possibly
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the government hoped that this measure, by arming the insurgents against
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: each other, would stifle the insurrection at its birth. This ordinance,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the cause of future fatal reprisals, was thus worded: "Independent
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: companies of troops shall be organized in the Western departments." This
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: impolitic step drove the West as a body into so hostile an attitude that
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the Directory despaired of immediately subduing it. Consequently, it
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: asked the Assemblies to pass certain special measures relating to the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: independent companies authorized by the ordinance. In response to this
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: request a new law had been promulgated a few days before this history
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: begins, organizing into regular legions the various weak and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: scattered companies. These legions were to bear the names of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: departments,--Sarthe, Orne, Mayenne, Ille-et-Vilaine, Morbihan,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Loire-Inferieure, and Maine-et-Loire. "These legions," said the law,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "will be specially employed to fight the Chouans, and cannot, under any
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: pretence, be sent to the frontier."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The foregoing irksome details will explain both the weakness of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Directory and the movement of this troop of men under escort of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Blues. It may not be superfluous to add that these finely patriotic
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Directorial decrees had no realization beyond their insertion among the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: statutes. No longer restrained, as formerly, by great moral ideas, by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: patriotism, nor by terror, which enforced their execution, these later
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: decrees of the Republic created millions and drafted soldiers without
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the slightest benefit accruing to its exchequer or its armies. The
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: mainspring of the Revolution was worn-out by clumsy handling, and the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: application of the laws took the impress of circumstances instead of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: controlling them.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The departments of Mayenne and Ille-et-Vilaine were at this time under
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the command of an old officer who, judging on the spot of the measures
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: that were most opportune to take, was anxious to wring from Brittany
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: every one of her contingents, more especially that of Fougeres, which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: was known to be a hot-bed of "Chouannerie." He hoped by this means to
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: weaken its strength in these formidable districts. This devoted soldier
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: made use of the illusory provisions of the new law to declare that he
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: would equip and arm at once all recruits, and he announced that he
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: held at their disposal the one month's advanced pay promised by the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: government to these exceptional levies. Though Brittany had hitherto
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: refused all kinds of military service under the Republic, the levies
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: were made under the new law on the faith of its promises, and with such
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: promptness that even the commander was startled. But he was one of those
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: wary old watch-dogs who are hard to catch napping. He no sooner saw the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: contingents arriving one after the other than he suspected some secret
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: motive for such prompt action. Possibly he was right in ascribing it
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to the fact of getting arms. At any rate, no sooner were the Fougeres
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: recruits obtained than, without delaying for laggards, he took
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: immediate steps to fall back towards Alencon, so as to be near a loyal
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: neighborhood,--though the growing disaffection along the route made
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the success of this measure problematical. This old officer, who, under
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: instruction of his superiors, kept secret the disasters of our armies in
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Italy and Germany and the disturbing news from La Vendee, was attempting
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: on the morning when this history begins, to make a forced march on
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Mayenne, where he was resolved to execute the law according to his own
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: good pleasure, and fill the half-empty companies of his own brigade
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: with his Breton conscripts. The word "conscript" which later became
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: so celebrated, had just now for the first time taken the place in the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: government decrees of the word _requisitionnaire_ hitherto applied to
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: all Republican recruits.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Before leaving Fougeres the chief secretly issued to his own men ample
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: supplies of ammunition and sufficient rations of bread for the whole
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: detachment, so as to conceal from the conscripts the length of the march
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: before them. He intended not to stop at Ernee (the last stage
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: before Mayenne), where the men of the contingent might find a way of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: communicating with the Chouans who were no doubt hanging on his flanks.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The dead silence which reigned among the recruits, surprised at the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: manoeuvring of the old republican, and their lagging march up the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: mountain excited to the very utmost the distrust and watchfulness of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: chief--whose name was Hulot. All the striking points in the foregoing
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: description had been to him matters of the keenest interest; he marched
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: in silence, surrounded by five young officers, each of whom respected
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the evident preoccupation of their leader. But just as Hulot reached the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: summit of La Pelerine he turned his head, as if by instinct, to inspect
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the anxious faces of the recruits, and suddenly broke silence. The slow
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: advance of the Bretons had put a distance of three or four hundred feet
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: between themselves and their escort. Hulot's face contorted after a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: fashion peculiar to himself.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "What the devil are those dandies up to?" he exclaimed in a sonorous
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: voice. "Creeping instead of marching, I call it."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: At his first words the officers who accompanied him turned
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: spasmodically, as if startled out of sleep by a sudden noise. The
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: sergeants and corporals followed their example, and the whole company
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Francine, horrified, looked at her in silence.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "Kill the man you love?" she said, in a soft voice.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "Yes, yes, if he ceases to love me."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: But after those ruthless words she hid her face in her hands, and sat
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: down silently.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The next day a man presented himself without being announced. His face
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: was stern. It was Hulot, followed by Corentin. Mademoiselle de Verneuil
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: looked at the commandant and trembled.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "You have come," she said, "to ask me to account for your friends. They
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: are dead."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "I know it," he replied, "and not in the service of the Republic."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "For me, and by me," she said. "You preach the nation to me. Can the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: nation bring to life those who die for her? Can she even avenge
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: them? But I--I will avenge them!" she cried. The awful images of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: catastrophe filled her imagination suddenly, and the graceful creature
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: who held modesty to be the first of women's wiles forgot herself in a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: moment of madness, and marched towards the amazed commandant brusquely.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "In exchange for a few murdered soldiers," she said, "I will bring to
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the block a head that is worth a million heads of other men. It is not a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: woman's business to wage war; but you, old as you are, shall learn good
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: stratagems from me. I'll deliver a whole family to your bayonets--him,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: his ancestors, his past, his future. I will be as false and treacherous
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to him as I was good and true. Yes, commandant, I will bring that little
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: noble to my arms, and he shall leave them to go to death. I have no
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: other rival. The wretch himself pronounced his doom,--_a day without a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: morrow_. Your Republic and I shall be avenged. The Republic!" she cried
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: in a voice the strange intonations of which horrified Hulot. "Is he to
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: die for bearing arms against the nation? Shall I suffer France to rob me
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of my vengeance? Ah! what a little thing is life! death can expiate but
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: one crime. He has but one head to fall, but I will make him know in one
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: night that he loses more than life. Commandant, you who will kill him,"
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and she sighed, "see that nothing betrays my betrayal; he must die
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: convinced of my fidelity. I ask that of you. Let him know only me--me,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and my caresses!"
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: She stopped; but through the crimson of her cheeks Hulot and Corentin
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: saw that rage and delirium had not entirely smothered all sense of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: shame. Marie shuddered violently as she said the words; she seemed to
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: listen to them as though she doubted whether she herself had said them,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and she made the involuntary movement of a woman whose veil is falling
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: from her.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "But you had him in your power," said Corentin.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "Very likely."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "Why did you stop me when I had him?" asked Hulot.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "I did not know what he would prove to be," she cried. Then, suddenly,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the excited woman, who was walking up and down with hurried steps and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: casting savage glances at the spectators of the storm, calmed down. "I
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: do not know myself," she said, in a man's tone. "Why talk? I must go and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: find him."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "Go and find him?" said Hulot. "My dear woman, take care; we are not yet
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: masters of this part of the country; if you venture outside of the town
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: you will be taken or killed before you've gone a hundred yards."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "There's never any danger for those who seek vengeance," she said,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: driving from her presence with a disdainful gesture the two men whom she
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: was ashamed to face.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "What a woman!" cried Hulot as he walked away with Corentin. "A queer
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: idea of those police fellows in Paris to send her here; but she'll never
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: deliver him up to us," he added, shaking his head.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "Oh yes, she will," replied Corentin.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "Don't you see she loves him?" said Hulot.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "That's just why she will. Besides," looking at the amazed commandant,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "I am here to see that she doesn't commit any folly. In my opinion,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: comrade, there is no love in the world worth the three hundred thousand
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: francs she'll make out of this."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: When the police diplomatist left the soldier the latter stood looking
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: after him, and as the sound of the man's steps died away he gave a sigh,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: muttering to himself, "It may be a good thing after all to be such a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: dullard as I am. God's thunder! if I meet the Gars I'll fight him hand
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to hand, or my name's not Hulot; for if that fox brings him before me in
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: any of their new-fangled councils of war, my honor will be as soiled as
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the shirt of a young trooper who is under fire for the first time."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The massacre at La Vivetiere, and the desire to avenge his friends had
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: led Hulot to accept a reinstatement in his late command; in fact, the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: new minister, Berthier, had refused to accept his resignation under
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: existing circumstances. To the official despatch was added a private
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: letter, in which, without explaining the mission of Mademoiselle de
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Verneuil, the minister informed him that the affair was entirely outside
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of the war, and not to interfere with any military operations. The duty
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of the commanders, he said, was limited to giving assistance to that
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: honorable _citoyenne_, if occasion arose. Learning from his scouts that
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the movements of the Chouans all tended towards a concentration of their
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: forces in the neighborhood of Fougeres, Hulot secretly and with forced
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: marches brought two battalions of his brigade into the town. The
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: nation's danger, his hatred of aristocracy, whose partisans threatened
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to convulse so large a section of country, his desire to avenge his
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: murdered friends, revived in the old veteran the fire of his youth.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "So this is the life I craved," exclaimed Mademoiselle de Verneuil, when
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: she was left alone with Francine. "No matter how fast the hours go, they
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: are to me like centuries of thought."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Suddenly she took Francine's hand, and her voice, soft as that of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the first red-throat singing after a storm, slowly gave sound to the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: following words:--
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "Try as I will to forget them, I see those two delicious lips, that chin
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: just raised, those eyes of fire; I hear the 'Hue!' of the postilion; I
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: dream, I dream,--why then such hatred on awakening!"
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: She drew a long sigh, rose, and then for the first time looked out upon
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the country delivered over to civil war by the cruel leader whom she was
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: plotting to destroy. Attracted by the scene she wandered out to breathe
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: at her ease beneath the sky; and though her steps conducted her at a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: venture, she was surely led to the Promenade of the town by one of those
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: occult impulses of the soul which lead us to follow hope irrationally.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Thoughts conceived under the dominion of that spell are often
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: realized; but we then attribute their pre-vision to a power we call
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: presentiment,--an inexplicable power, but a real one,--which our
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: passions find accommodating, like a flatterer who, among his many lies,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: does sometimes tell the truth.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: III. A DAY WITHOUT A MORROW
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The preceding events of this history having been greatly influenced by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the formation of the regions in which they happened, it is desirable
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to give a minute description of them, without which the closing scenes
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: might be difficult of comprehension.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The town of Fougeres is partly built upon a slate rock, which seems to
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: have slipped from the mountains that hem in the broad valley of Couesnon
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to the west and take various names according to their localities. The
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: town is separated from the mountains by a gorge, through which flows a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: small river called the Nancon. To the east, the view is the same as from
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the summit of La Pelerine; to the west, the town looks down into the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: tortuous valley of the Nancon; but there is a spot from which a section
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of the great valley and the picturesque windings of the gorge can be
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: seen at the same time. This place, chosen by the inhabitants of the town
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: for their Promenade, and to which the steps of Mademoiselle de Verneuil
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: were now turned, was destined to be the theatre on which the drama begun
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: at La Vivetiere was to end. Therefore, however picturesque the other
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: parts of Fougeres may be, attention must be particularly given to the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: scenery which meets the eye from this terrace.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: To give an idea of the rock on which Fougeres stands, as seen on this
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: side, we may compare it to one of those immense towers circled by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Saracen architects with balconies on each story, which were reached by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: spiral stairways. To add to this effect, the rock is capped by a Gothic
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: church, the small spires, clock-tower, and buttresses of which make its
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: shape almost precisely that of a sugar-loaf. Before the portal of this
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: church, which is dedicated to Saint-Leonard, is a small, irregular
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: square, where the soil is held up by a buttressed wall, which forms a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: balustrade and communicates by a flight of steps with the Promenade.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: This public walk, like a second cornice, extends round the rock a few
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: rods below the square of Saint-Leonard; it is a broad piece of ground
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: planted with trees, and it joins the fortifications of the town. About
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: ten rods below the walls and rocks which support this Promenade (due
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to a happy combination of indestructible slate and patient industry)
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: another circular road exists, called the "Queen's Staircase"; this is
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: cut in the rock itself and leads to a bridge built across the Nancon by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Anne of Brittany. Below this road, which forms a third cornice, gardens
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: descend, terrace after terrace, to the river, like shelves covered with
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: flowers.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Parallel with the Promenade, on the other side of the Nancon and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: across its narrow valley, high rock-formations, called the heights of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Saint-Sulpice, follow the stream and descend in gentle slopes to the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: great valley, where they turn abruptly to the north. Towards the south,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: where the town itself really ends and the faubourg Saint-Leonard begins,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the Fougeres rock makes a bend, becomes less steep, and turns into
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the great valley, following the course of the river, which it hems in
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: between itself and the heights of Saint-Sulpice, forming a sort of pass
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: through which the water escapes in two streamlets to the Couesnon,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: into which they fall. This pretty group of rocky hills is called the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "Nid-aux-Crocs"; the little vale they surround is the "Val de Gibarry,"
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the rich pastures of which supply the butter known to epicures as that
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of the "Pree-Valaye."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: At the point where the Promenade joins the fortifications is a tower
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: called the "Tour de Papegaut." Close to this square erection, against
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the side of which the house now occupied by Mademoiselle de Verneuil
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: rested, is a wall, partly built by hands and partly formed of the native
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: rock where it offered a smooth surface. Here stands a gateway leading
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to the faubourg of Saint-Sulpice and bearing the same name. Above, on
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: a breastwork of granite which commands the three valleys, rise the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: battlements and feudal towers of the ancient castle of Fougeres,--one
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of those enormous erections built by the Dukes of Brittany, with lofty
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: walls fifteen feet thick, protected on the east by a pond from which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: flows the Nancon, the waters of which fill its moats, and on the west by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the inaccessible granite rock on which it stands.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Seen from the Promenade, this magnificent relic of the Middle Ages,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: wrapped in its ivy mantle, adorned with its square or rounded towers,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: in either of which a whole regiment could be quartered,--the castle, the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: town, and the rock, protected by walls with sheer surfaces, or by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the glacis of the fortifications, form a huge horseshoe, lined with
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: precipices, on which the Bretons have, in course of ages, cut various
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: narrow footways. Here and there the rocks push out like architectural
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: adornments. Streamlets issue from the fissures, where the roots of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: stunted trees are nourished. Farther on, a few rocky slopes, less
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: perpendicular than the rest, afford a scanty pasture for the goats. On
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: all sides heather, growing from every crevice, flings its rosy garlands
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: over the dark, uneven surface of the ground. At the bottom of this vast
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: funnel the little river winds through meadows that are always cool and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: green, lying softly like a carpet.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Beneath the castle and among the granite boulders is a church dedicated
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to Saint-Sulpice, whose name is given to the suburb which lies across
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the Nancon. This suburb, flung as it were to the bottom of a precipice,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and its church, the spire of which does not rise to the height of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: rocks which threaten to crush it, are picturesquely watered by several
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: affluents of the Nancon, shaded by trees and brightened by gardens. The
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: whole region of Fougeres, its suburbs, its churches, and the hills of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Saint-Sulpice are surrounded by the heights of Rille, which form part of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: a general range of mountains enclosing the broad valley of Couesnon.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Such are the chief features of this landscape, the principal
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: characteristic of which is a rugged wildness softened by smiling
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: accidents, by a happy blending of the finest works of men's hands
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: with the capricious lay of a land full of unexpected contrasts, by a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: something, hardly to be explained, which surprises, astonishes, and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: puzzles. In no other part of France can the traveller meet with such
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: grandiose contrasts as those offered by the great basin of the Couesnon,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and the valleys hidden among the rocks of Fougeres and the heights of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Rille. Their beauty is of that unspeakable kind in which chance triumphs
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and all the harmonies of Nature do their part. The clear, limpid,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: flowing waters, the mountains clothed with the vigorous vegetation
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of those regions, the sombre rocks, the graceful buildings, the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: fortifications raised by nature, and the granite towers built by man;
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: combined with all the artifices of light and shade, with the contrasts
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of the varieties of foliage, with the groups of houses where an active
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: population swarms, with the lonely barren places where the granite will
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: not suffer even the lichen to fasten on its surface, in short, with all
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the ideas we ask a landscape to possess: grace and awfulness, poesy with
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: its renascent magic, sublime pictures, delightful ruralities,--all these
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: are here; it is Brittany in bloom.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The tower called the Papegaut, against which the house now occupied by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Mademoiselle de Verneuil rested, has its base at the very bottom of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: precipice, and rises to the esplanade which forms the cornice or terrace

text: them on the hedge-banks which are called "rotes"; and these begin and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: end with each division into fields. In order to cross from one field to
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: another it is necessary to climb the clay banks by means of steps which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: are often very slippery after a rain.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Travellers have many other obstacles to encounter in these intricate
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: paths. Thus surrounded, each field is closed by what is called in the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: West an _echalier_. That is a trunk or stout branch of a tree, one end
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of which, being pierced, is fitted to an upright post which serves as a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: pivot on which it turns. One end of the _echalier_ projects far enough
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: beyond the pivot to hold a weight, and this singular rustic gate, the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: post of which rests in a hole made in the bank, is so easy to work that
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: a child can handle it. Sometimes the peasants economize the stone which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: forms the weight by lengthening the trunk or branch beyond the pivot.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: This method of enclosure varies with the genius of each proprietor.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Sometimes it consists of a single trunk or branch, both ends of which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: are embedded in the bank. In other places it looks like a gate, and is
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: made of several slim branches placed at regular distances like the steps
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of a ladder lying horizontally. The form turns, like the _echalier_, on
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: a pivot. These "hedges" and _echaliers_ give the region the appearance
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of a huge chess-board, each field forming a square, perfectly isolated
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: from the rest, closed like a fortress and protected by ramparts. The
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: gate, which is very easy to defend, is a dangerous spot for assailants.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The Breton peasant thinks he improves his fallow land by encouraging the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: growth of gorse, a shrub so well treated in these regions that it soon
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: attains the height of a man. This delusion, worthy of a population which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: puts its manure on the highest spot in the courtyard, has covered the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: soil to a proportion of one fourth with masses of gorse, in the midst
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of which a thousand men might ambush. Also there is scarcely a field
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: without a number of old apple-trees, the fruit being used for cider,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: which kill the vegetation wherever their branches cover the ground. Now,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: if the reader will reflect on the small extent of open ground within
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: these hedges and large trees whose hungry roots impoverish the soil, he
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: will have an idea of the cultivation and general character of the region
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: through which Mademoiselle de Verneuil was now passing.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: It is difficult to say whether the object of these enclosures is to
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: avoid all disputes of possession, or whether the custom is a lazy one of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: keeping the cattle from straying, without the trouble of watching them;
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: at any rate such formidable barriers are permanent obstacles, which make
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: these regions impenetrable and ordinary warfare impossible. There lies
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the whole secret of the Chouan war. Mademoiselle de Verneuil saw plainly
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the necessity the Republic was under to strangle the disaffection by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: means of police and by negotiation, rather than by a useless employment
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of military force. What could be done, in fact, with a people wise
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: enough to despise the possession of towns, and hold to that of an open
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: country already furnished with indestructible fortifications? Surely,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: nothing except negotiate; especially as the whole active strength of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: these deluded peasants lay in a single able and enterprising leader. She
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: admired the genius of the minister who, sitting in his study, had
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: been able to grasp the true way of procuring peace. She thought she
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: understood the considerations which act on the minds of men powerful
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: enough to take a bird's-eye view of an empire; men whose actions,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: criminal in the eyes of the masses, are the outcome of a vast and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: intelligent thought. There is in these terrible souls some mysterious
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: blending of the force of fate and that of destiny, some prescience which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: suddenly elevates them above their fellows; the masses seek them for a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: time in their own ranks, then they raise their eyes and see these lordly
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: souls above them.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Such reflections as these seemed to Mademoiselle de Verneuil to justify
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and even to ennoble her thoughts of vengeance; this travail of her soul
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: and its expectations gave her vigor enough to bear the unusual fatigues
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of this strange journey. At the end of each property Galope-Chopine made
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the women dismount from their donkeys and climb the obstructions;
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: then, mounting again, they made their way through the boggy paths which
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: already felt the approach of winter. The combination of tall trees,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: sunken paths, and enclosed places, kept the soil in a state of humidity
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: which wrapped the travellers in a mantle of ice. However, after much
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: wearisome fatigue, they managed to reach the woods of Marignay by
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: sunrise. The journey then became less difficult, and led by a broad
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: footway through the forest. The arch formed by the branches, and the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: great size of the trees protected the travellers from the weather, and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the many difficulties of the first half of their way did not recur.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: They had hardly gone a couple of miles through the woods before they
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: heard a confused noise of distant voices and the tinkling of a bell, the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: silvery tones of which did not have the monotonous sound given by the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: movements of cattle. Galope-Chopine listened with great attention, as he
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: walked along, to this melody; presently a puff of wind brought several
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: chanted words to his ear, which seemed to affect him powerfully, for he
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: suddenly turned the wearied donkeys into a by-path, which led away from
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Saint-James, paying no attention to the remonstrances of Mademoiselle de
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Verneuil, whose fears were increased by the darkness of the forest path
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: along which their guide now led them. To right and left were enormous
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: blocks of granite, laid one upon the other, of whimsical shape. Across
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: them huge roots had glided, like monstrous serpents, seeking from afar
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the juicy nourishment enjoyed by a few beeches. The two sides of the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: road resembled the subterranean grottos that are famous for stalactites.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Immense festoons of stone, where the darkling verdure of ivy and holly
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: allied itself to the green-gray patches of the moss and lichen, hid
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the precipices and the openings into several caves. When the three
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: travellers had gone a few steps through a very narrow path a most
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: surprising spectacle suddenly unfolded itself to Mademoiselle de
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Verneuil's eyes, and made her understand the obstinacy of her Chouan
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: guide.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: A semi-circular basin of granite blocks formed an ampitheatre, on the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: rough tiers of which rose tall black pines and yellowing chestnuts, one
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: above the other, like a vast circus, where the wintry sun shed its pale
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: colors rather than poured its light, and autumn had spread her tawny
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: carpet of fallen leaves. About the middle of this hall, which seemed
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to have had the deluge for its architect, stood three enormous Druid
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: stones,--a vast altar, on which was raised an old church-banner. About
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: a hundred men, kneeling with bared heads, were praying fervently in this
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: natural enclosure, where a priest, assisted by two other ecclesiastics,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: was saying mass. The poverty of the sacerdotal vestments, the feeble
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: voice of the priest, which echoed like a murmur through the open space,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the praying men filled with conviction and united by one and the same
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: sentiment, the bare cross, the wild and barren temple, the dawning day,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: gave the primitive character of the earlier times of Christianity to the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: scene. Mademoiselle de Verneuil was struck with admiration. This mass
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: said in the depths of the woods, this worship driven back by persecution
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to its sources, the poesy of ancient times revived in the midst of this
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: weird and romantic nature, these armed and unarmed Chouans, cruel and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: praying, men yet children, all these things resembled nothing that she
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: had ever seen or yet imagined. She remembered admiring in her childhood
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the pomps of the Roman church so pleasing to the senses; but she knew
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: nothing of God _alone_, his cross on the altar, his altar the earth. In
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: place of the carved foliage of a Gothic cathedral, the autumnal trees
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: upheld the sky; instead of a thousand colors thrown through stained
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: glass windows, the sun could barely slide its ruddy rays and dull
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: reflections on altar, priest, and people. The men present were a fact,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: a reality, and not a system,--it was a prayer, not a religion. But human
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: passions, the momentary repression of which gave harmony to the picture,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: soon reappeared on this mysterious scene and gave it powerful vitality.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: As Mademoiselle de Verneuil reached the spot the reading of the gospel
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: was just over. She recognized in the officiating priest, not without
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: fear, the Abbe Gudin, and she hastily slipped behind a granite
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: block, drawing Francine after her. She was, however, unable to move
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Galope-Chopine from the place he had chosen, and from which he intended
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to share in the benefits of the ceremony; but she noticed the nature
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of the ground around her, and hoped to be able to evade the danger by
title: The Chouans

text: getting away, when the service was over, before the priests. Through a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: large fissure of the rock that hid her, she saw the Abbe Gudin mounting
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: a block of granite which served him as a pulpit, where he began his
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: sermon with the words,--
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "_In nomine Patris et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti_."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: All present made the sign of the cross.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "My dear friends," continued the abbe, "let us pray in the first place
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: for the souls of the dead,--Jean Cochegrue, Nicalos Laferte, Joseph
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of wounds received in the fight on Mont Pelerine and at the siege of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Fougeres. _De profundis_," etc.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: The psalm was recited, according to custom, by the congregation and the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: priests, taking verses alternately with a fervor which augured well for
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the success of the sermon. When it was over the abbe continued, in a
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: voice which became gradually louder and louder, for the former Jesuit
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: was not unaware that vehemence of delivery was in itself a powerful
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: argument with which to persuade his semi-savage hearers.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "These defenders of our God, Christians, have set you an example of
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: duty," he said. "Are you not ashamed of what will be said of you in
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: paradise? If it were not for these blessed ones, who have just been
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: received with open arms by all the saints, our Lord might have thought
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: that your parish is inhabited by Mahometans!--Do you know, men, what
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: is said of you in Brittany and in the king's presence? What! you don't
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: know? Then I shall tell you. They say: 'Behold, the Blues have cast down
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: altars, and killed priests, and murdered the king and queen; they mean
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to make the parish folk of Brittany Blues like themselves, and send them
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to fight in foreign lands, away from their churches, where they run the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: risk of dying without confession and going eternally to hell; and yet
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the gars of Marignay, whose churches they have burned, stand still with
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: folded arms! Oh! oh! this Republic of damned souls has sold the property
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of God and that of the nobles at auction; it has shared the proceeds
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: with the Blues; it has decreed, in order to gorge itself with money
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: as it does with blood, that a crown shall be only worth three francs

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: instead of six; and yet the gars of Marignay haven't seized their
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: weapons and driven the Blues from Brittany! Ha! paradise will be closed
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to them! they can never save their souls!' That's what they say of you
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: in the king's presence! It is your own salvation, Christians, which is
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: at stake. Your souls are to be saved by fighting for religion and the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: king. Saint Anne of Auray herself appeared to me yesterday at half-past
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: two o'clock; and she said to me these very words which I now repeat to

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: you: 'Are you a priest of Marignay?' 'Yes, madame, ready to serve you.'
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: 'I am Saint Anne of Auray, aunt of God, after the manner of Brittany. I
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: have come to bid you warn the people of Marignay that they must not
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: hope for salvation if they do not take arms. You are to refuse them

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: absolution for their sins unless they serve God. Bless their guns, and

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: those who gain absolution will never miss the Blues, because their guns

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: are sanctified.' She disappeared, leaving an odor of incense behind her.
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: I marked the spot. It is under the oak of the Patte d'Oie; just where
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: that beautiful wooden Virgin was placed by the rector of Saint-James;
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to whom the crippled mother of Pierre Leroi (otherwise called
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: Marche-a-Terre) came to pray, and was cured of all her pains, because

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: of her son's good deeds. You see her there in the midst of you, and
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: you know that she walks without assistance. It was a miracle--a miracle
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: intended, like the resurrection of Marie Lambrequin to prove to you that
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: God will never forsake the Breton cause so long as the people fight for
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: his servants and for the king. Therefore, my dear brothers, if you wish

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: to save your souls and show yourselves defenders of God and the king,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: you will obey all the orders of the man whom God has sent to us, and

text: whom we call THE GARS. Then indeed, you will no longer be Mahometans;
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: you will rank with all the gars of Brittany under the flag of God. You

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: can take from the pockets of the Blues the money they have stolen from
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: you; for, if the fields have to go uncultivated while you are making

title: The Chouans

author: Balzac, Honoré de

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: or listen to them as she did in the last war."

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: This appeal, enforced by the power of a loud voice and by many gestures,
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: the vehemence of which bathed the orator in perspiration, produced,

text: be here now."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: "You've a cold heart, Corentin. You can draw shrewd conclusions as to
title: The Chouans

title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

author: Balzac, Honoré de

title: The Chouans

title: The Chouans

title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

title: The Chouans

title: The Chouans

title: The Chouans

title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

title: The Chouans

author: Balzac, Honoré de

author: Balzac, Honoré de

author: Balzac, Honoré de

title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

author: Balzac, Honoré de

title: The Chouans

author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: In 1827 an old man accompanied by his wife was buying cattle in the
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: market-place of Fougeres. Few persons remembered that he had killed
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: a hundred or more men, and that his former name was Marche-a-Terre. A
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

text: this drama saw him there, leading a cow, and was struck by his simple,
title: The Chouans

text: ingenuous air, which led her to remark, "That must be a worthy man."
title: The Chouans
author: Balzac, Honoré de

title: The Chouans

title: The Chouans
